Judge in E. Jean Carroll Case: Yes, Donald Trump Is a Rapist
A judge rejected Trump’s semantic attempt to throw out the case.
On Wednesday, Trump’s request for a new trial in the E. Jean Carroll case, after he was found liable for sexual abuse, battery, and defamation, was rejected. And in his desperate attempt to avoid accountability, the twice-impeached and twice-indicted former president may have unintentionally allowed himself to now be formally known as a rapist.
Trump’s team had requested a new trial in the case, arguing that the $5 million in damages he was ordered to pay Carroll was excessive, because he was only charged with sexual abuse. The jury had not found that Trump “raped” Carroll, a talking point Trump’s team often parroted.
But Judge Lewis Kaplan called Trump’s semantic argument “entirely unpersuasive.” He clarified that the jury found that the former president did indeed “rape” Carroll based on the common definition of the word.
Kaplan noted that New York penal law (the jury in the Carroll case was based in New York) has a “far narrower” definition of the word “rape” than in “common modern parlance, its definition in some dictionaries, in some federal and state criminal statutes, and elsewhere.”
“The finding that Ms. Carroll failed to prove that she was ‘raped’ within the meaning of the New York Penal Law does not mean that she failed to prove that Mr. Trump ‘raped’ her as many people commonly understand the word ‘rape,’” Kaplan wrote.
“Indeed, as the evidence at trial recounted below makes clear, the jury found that Mr. Trump in fact did exactly that [rape, as ‘commonly’ understood].”
“A United States District Judge has now formally held, in a lengthy written opinion, that it is perfectly appropriate, and, indeed, entirely accurate, to call a certain former President of the United States a rapist,” noted George Conway, lawyer and husband to former Trump aide Kellyanne Conway.
All that to say, based on the legal language, a rapist—for the third presidential cycle in a row—is leading the 2024 Republican primary.
Prem Thakker
July 19, 2023/2:05 p.m. ET

Piath: Taylor, I've been reflecting on the nature of truth. It seems like a simple issue, but the more I think about it, the more complex it becomes.

Taylor: That's true, Piath. Truth can have many faces. From a philosophical perspective, for example, there are various theories. The correspondence theory holds that truth corresponds with reality, while the coherence theory sees truth as coherence within a system of beliefs.

Piath: Exactly, Taylor. When we look at science, truth is based on constant observation and experimentation. But even in science, "truths" can change with new discoveries.

Taylor: That makes me think about the religious and spiritual dimension, where truth is often associated with divine teachings or universal moral laws. Each tradition has its particular vision.

Piath: And moreover, each individual has their own subjective perspective of truth, based on personal experiences and perceptions. My truth might be very different from yours.

Taylor: That's true. And that's without considering the impact of culture and society on what we consider truth. What is true in one culture may not be so in another.

Piath: That's why I think that the search for truth is a dynamic process. It requires an open mind, constant critical examination, and the willingness to adapt our understandings.

Taylor: You're right, Piath. Truth isn't a matter of black or white  it's a spectrum of greys, always in motion and evolving with new perspectives and information. It's truly a continuous adventure in our exploration of the world.

column1:
Finally got around to watching Taylor Swift: Eras Tour concert film online for free
Crazy I had to wait 2 months 

The film is long as you'd expect a concert performance would be so it is strictly for hardcore lovers
Even if that's the case you have to admit you can't deny her enthusiasm and commitment to perform for everyone
Like any artist or band the fans really make the success work
The scope, style, and size of this is tremendous and really catches your eye, everything from the lighting to the staging is spectacular 
Taylor expresses brilliantly through her music how far she has come through invention and self-reinvention 
In our current IP-based age of content there's still ways to please the consumers 
The 3 hour running time is staggering but all Swifties will gobble up every second of Taylor pouring her heart out on stage

column1:
Swifties, I'm so proud of our Taylor and of us as well. I feel so powerful to see her become this powerful, this beautiful, nurtured,  matured and professional human. I'm crying right now seeing her evolution although iknow this is not the end. She always has more to offer us when I almost think there's nothing left. She makes it all possible. It's such a great and wholesome feeling to watch her become this big. She writes so much, creates so much and goes on tours as well like she's been always enjoying her work, her music, being with us. It makes me so proud, I'm a proud swiftie.

Although what I'm saying below this might be out of context. Now that I look back on, that whole kanye kim beefs, and red not winning for album of the year grammy, this was all necessary to happen for us to watch her new creations. And also with her record labels issues, although I was sad at that time for her but it's okay now bc I got to relive my old days with her old albums. It was all so nostlagic.

The film captures Swift's iconic performances from her various eras, showcasing her evolution as an artist. The trailer features snippets of electrifying live performances, stunning visuals, and behind-the-scenes moments, giving fans a taste of what to expect from the full film. With its high-energy atmosphere and Swift's captivating stage presence, the concert film promises to be a must-watch for fans and music lovers alike.

I just got my tickets and I am SO stoked!!! I'm going on 10/31 and I'm wearing my "A Lot Going On at The Moment" shirt that she wears during the Red Era, a black fedora, black shorts, and I'll have a friendship bracelet or a few that say "Lover" and other things on them. As someone who tried during both pre-sales to get tickets, couldn't, watched livestreams of the whole show, but couldn't actually go, because TICKETMASTER, *cough* I feel like Taylor is doing her fans who couldn't come a real solid here with this release. I feel like it's her way of making things right not only with her fans because Ticketmaster screwed us over, but it's also very smart of her from a business sense. Tickets are already selling today and it was just announced in my area this morning. I don't care what anyone says, Swiftie for life here. Can't wait to see this!!!!! I wonder what will the chosen surprise songs be. If I'm guessing I'd say Our Song & YOYOK, but who knows... Taking into account this seems to be from the first 3 LA shows. She recorded, like... 6 of them right? Wait. Okay. Hear me out. I don't know if this could be doable or how to properly explain it, but what if... There's just not one edited, set in stone, set of surprise songs for the film, but instead all 6 are edited and 2 of them randomly chosen in every showing? Like, a theater in Mexico gets YOYOK and DBATC and a theater in Texas gets Maroon and Our Song. Or like, the 5pm showing gets ICS and YIL, and the 7pm gets DBATC and Maroon. Like, a cinema in Mexico gets YOYOK and DBATC and a cinema in Texas gets Maroon and Our Song. Or like, the 5pm screening gets ICS and YIL, and the 7pm gets DBATC and Maroon.
